required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Formulations of Androxal
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind Crossover Study In Healthy Volunteers to Compare Two Formulations of Androxal

brief_summary.textblock: To determine and compare the pharmacokinetics (PK) of a single dose of each of two formulations Androxal

detailed_description.textblock: To determine and compare the pharmacokinetics (PK) of a single dose of each of two formulations of 12.5 mg and 25 mg Androxal administered to healthy male volunteers, and to determine and compare the safety of a single dose each of two formulations of 12.5 mg and 25 mg Androxal administered to healthy male volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: To determine and compare the pharmacokinetic parameter Cmax between two formulations of Androxal
To determine and compare the PK parameter Cmax between two formulations of Androxal

arm_group.description: 12.5 mg Androxal formulation A and 12.5 mg Androxal formulation B, a single dose of each formulation
25 mg Androxal formulation A and 12.5 mg Androxal formulation B, a single dose of each formulation

intervention.description: Single dose of 12.5 mg Androxal formulation A
Single dose of 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation B
Single dose of 25 mg Androxal formulation A
Single dose of 25 mg Androxal formulation B

group.title: 12.5 mg Androxal (Formulation A), Then B
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation A or 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 12.5 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

group.title: 12.5 mg Androxal (Formulation B), Then A
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation A or 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 12.5 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

group.title: 25 mg Androxal (Formulation A), Then B
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 25 mg Androxal formulation A or 25 mg Androxal formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 25 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

group.title: 25 mg Androxal (Formulation B), Then A
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 25 mg Androxal formulation A or 25 mg Androxal formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 25 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

group.title: 12.5 mg Androxal (Formulations A and B)
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation A or 12.5 mg Androxal Formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 12.5 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

group.title: 25 mg Androxal (Formulations A and B)
group.description: During Treatment Period 1, participants were randomly assigned to a single dose of either 25 mg Androxal formulation A or 25 mg Androxal formulation B. After the washout period, participants then crossed over to receive the alternate 25 mg formulation during Treatment Period 2, ensuring all participants had received one dose of Formulation A and one dose of Formulation B.

outcome.title: Androxal Cmax Formulation A
outcome.description: To determine and compare the pharmacokinetic parameter Cmax between two formulations of Androxal
outcome.population: Safety and PK populations are the same

group.description: A single dose of 12.5 mg Androxal formulation A, received either during Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.description: A single dose of 25 mg Androxal Formulation A, received either during Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

group.description: A single dose of 12.5 mg Androxal formulation B, received either during Treatment Period 1 or Treatment Period 2.

measure.description: To determine and compare the PK parameter Cmax between two formulations of Androxal
measure.population: Safety and PK populations are the same

reported_events.time_frame: From Day 0 up to Day 8. (Up to 24 hours after last dose of study drug in Treatment Period 2)
reported_events.desc: Adverse event data is presented for each Formulation (A and B) and dose (12.5mg and 25mg) of Androxal.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Prior to publication, Investigator shall submit to the Sponsor a copy of any proposed publication. Sponsor shall have sixty (60) days to review the proposed publication for possible disclosure of Sponsor’s Confidential Information and, upon request of Sponsor, Investigator shall delete any of Sponsor’s Confidential Information or withhold submission of such publication to allow Sponsor to protect its intellectual property rights
